case_vignette: A mother brings in her 7-year-old son because she is worried about his behavior after his teacher called. The patient’s mother says she was told that he has not been doing his assignments and frequently tells his teachers that he forgets about them. In addition, he tends to have a difficult time sitting still in class and frequently disrupts the other children. This behavior has been going on for about 8 months, but recently it worsened prompting his teacher to bring it to his mother’s attention. The patient’s mother was surprised to hear about these issues; however, she admits that she needs to repeat herself several times when asking her son to complete his chores. He also has trouble sitting still when doing homework.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I often forget to do my assignments, have a hard time sitting still, and I tend to disrupt other kids in my class.
How old are you?
I'm 7 years old.
Are you male or female?
I am a boy.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
About 8 months.
Have your parents or teachers noticed these behaviors at home or at school?
Yes, my teacher noticed and told my mom, and my mom has to repeat things to me a lot at home.
Have you had any previous medical evaluation or treatment for these symptoms?
No, I haven't had any medical evaluation or treatment for these symptoms.
Do you experience any difficulties with sleeping or do you have periods of increased energy at night?
The case vignette doesn't mention anything about my sleep or energy levels at night.
Do you often act without thinking or have trouble waiting your turn in games or groups?
The case vignette doesn't provide specific information about me acting without thinking or having trouble waiting my turn.
Do you have any other medical conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
The case vignette doesn't mention any other medical conditions or medications that I'm taking.
Do these behaviors happen only in school or also in other environments, like at home or during activities outside of school?
These behaviors happen both in school and at home, like when I'm doing my homework or need to complete chores.
Do any of your immediate family members, like parents or siblings, have similar symptoms or have been diagnosed with any attention or behavioral disorders?
The case vignette doesn't say anything about my family members having similar symptoms or diagnoses.
Final Diagnosis: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
